The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: At first I was trying to not get on the hate bandwagon for the game\, and at a point in my playthrough I’d have given it a higher score. But after finishing the game\, a few things could’ve been done better. Namely\, how Abby’s group got ahold of Joel\, and the structure of the game. I think they could’ve made him getting captured much more believable\, even if it’s just snippets throughout the games flashbacks showing how he’s gotten kinder to strangers\, and is quicker to trust them after being sheltered in a community for four years. He was essentially living the high life (or at least the kind you could live in a post-apocalyptic world)\, and they could’ve highlighted that in certain scenes of the game a lot better.The other thing would be to structure the game better\, and to make it so you aren’t just hopping around a three day time period and then going in to a flashback during the flashback when you play as Abby. Aside from those major gripes\, the games actually very good\, story and gameplay-wise\, and I don’t know what people are so irrationally angry about.… Expand
